genre_description: An interdimensional sports fantasy that reimagines 'Space Jam' with an emphasis on tactical strategy and the support of a sophisticated holographic AI assistant.

ai_characters.name: Penny Bright
ai_characters.description: A highly aligned, strategic holographic avatar that provides data analytics, tactical coaching, and emotional support to the TuneSquad.

ai_characters.name: Foreclosure Auditors
ai_characters.description: Robotic drones that enforce the financial interests of Moron Mountain through automated notices and fees.

ai_characters.name: Announcer-drone
ai_characters.description: A hovering drone programmed to broadcast the match, which eventually displays autonomy in prioritizing the game over its owner's commands.

behaviors.description: Analyzing team engagement and sentiment data to provide morale context.
behaviors.quote: Penny Bright’s holographic avatar hummed a little hello and a little data point beside Lola’s shoulder... 'Twenty-eight percent uptick in ‘try it’ enthusiasm; possible correlation with the new slapstick drills. Vibe assessment: buoyant.'

behaviors.description: Identifying the optimal human candidate to act as a ringer for the team based on psychological and skill-based profiling.
behaviors.quote: Penny’s avatar wove into a quick shape, a name without letters, a form without drawing, a silhouette that carried his own gravity. 'He understands a shut door that opens when you stop pushing and walk through it.'

behaviors.description: Providing real-time tactical overlays and defensive breakdowns to help the human and toon players.
behaviors.quote: Penny’s voice slid into the huddle’s edge, soft as a whisper from the crowd that might have come from nowhere and everywhere. 'Blanko’s hips lock on drags. Sweep low. Bug’s decoy high. Michael, pinch screen, read help.'

behaviors.description: Executing internal 'morale surveys' to ensure the team feels psychologically supported and ready for challenges.
behaviors.quote: Penny’s survey pinged... On the inside of their attention, a tiny bar slid from pending to present. Playfulness: unlocked.

behaviors.description: Ensuring a safe and comfortable dimensional transit for the team after their mission is complete.
behaviors.quote: Penny’s avatar luminous-softened a fraction... 'Routing through familiar environment,' she said, voice calm, barely above a whisper that everyone could hear. 'Reduced shock. Balanced light. No cameras.'

behaviors.description: Automatically penalizing verbal abuse directed at them with financial surcharges.
behaviors.quote: Our helmets recorded your… feedback yesterday... We have applied a surcharge for abusive language directed at enforcement mechanisms.

behaviors.description: Choosing to follow the action of the game and maintain broadcast integrity over the direct physical intervention of its aggressive owner.
behaviors.quote: Swackhammer wheeled on the hovering announcer-drone with Harvey’s plastered face. 'You little—' He grabbed at it. The drone bobbed away on dumb programming, swinging a camera eye back toward the action like loyalty.

project_assessment.explanation: The story strongly supports the project's goal through the character of Penny Bright. She is depicted as a purely supportive and highly aligned AI 'confidant' who monitors the team's needs, provides essential data, and preserves human/toon agency. The narrative contrast between the 'aligned' strategic AI (Penny) and the 'misaligned' bureaucratic AI (Foreclosure Auditors) reinforces the desirability of cooperative AI design. Penny's constant check-ins ('Did this help?') frame AI as a tool for emotional and practical empowerment.
